data.title: [Windows] Change graphics backend to use Direct3D 11 by default

milestone.title: Issue Staging
milestone.description: A staging area for milestones, while we work through the backlog

data.body:
Going forward with the implementation of graphic features, it appears that supporting d3d9 as the default rendering backend is making things more tedious that they should be. 

According to http://store.steampowered.com/hwsurvey the userbase of d3d9 is getting really low nowdays. Sure there's still country / userbase other than steam users that still use d3d9 but we can keep the d3d9 backend for those who needs it, but as an option rather than the default settings.

This means that features integrated after that change would not require to support d3d9, so we can move forward more quickly.

That's why it would be nice to default to d3d11 as the rendering backend.

data.title: [Editor] Unwanted popup windows (hotkeys) with localized keyboard

milestone.title: Issue Staging
milestone.description: A staging area for milestones, while we work through the backlog

data.body:
Hi!

I found a little problem related with hotkeys. On localized keyboard layot (for example hungarian layout) the special characters (open curly bracket, |, etc) are activates hotkeys. For example in my case every pressing of open curly bracket character (AltGr + b) opens the Build Settings dialog. It is not a blocking issue, but a little bit annoying.

data.title: [Engine] Should be able to scale global timestep

milestone.title: Issue Staging
milestone.description: A staging area for milestones, while we work through the backlog

data.body:
There are scenarios in which the global timestep would need to be scaled, as an example when all animations should be played in slow motion. I'd suggest modifying the update message to include the actual timestep, scaled timestep, user specified scale and any other useful timing information. 

Current subscribers to this message would need to be updated to use the scaled value.

data.title: [Editor] View the size of the collider2D in the editor
data.body: view the size of the collider2D in the editor, right now it only works in play mode with the PhysicsWorld2D::DrawDebugGeometry(), but this method render all components in the scene. Implement DrawDebugGeometry in CollisionShape2D or in the derived classes

data.title: [Editor, Windows] Web view and code editor not working in OpenGL build on Windows
data.body: Web view and Monaco don't seem to be working in OpenGL build on Windows

data.title: [Editor] Renamed/deleted files not synchronized properly
data.body: Files deleted from the file system do not disappear from the tree in Atomic (may be [Windows]?)

data.title: [Editor] Allow multiple selections in the resources file tree
data.body: Only a single file can be selected for deletion at a time.

data.title: [Editor] Allow drag select of objects in the scene
data.body: Objects can be selected by shift-clicking, but drag select would be very useful.

data.title: [Editor] Indicate when gizmo is behind another object in the scene
data.body:
At the moment the debug geometry / bounding box of objects being manipulated in the scene looks the same regardless of whether the object is in front or behind of other objects in the scene. Whilst it makes sense for the gizmo to still be visible behind other objects when selected, it should change color or otherwise indicate in some way so that we know we've passed through another object when positioning.
Longer axis lines that pass through and get occluded by other objects could also be useful in this.

data.title: [Editor] Dragging objects into the scene should snap them to existing geometry
data.body: If we drag a character onto the terrain, or onto a platform in the scene, the editor should use a ray pick to spawn him on the actual surface we're pointing to and not simply floating somewhere in front of the mouse's screen coordinates.

data.title: [Editor] Double clicking on material/image name in mesh inspector should open material inspector
data.body: Right now its not so easy to get from a text box in the inspector to the material or image that it relates to. It can highlight the item in the file list but it doesn't actually launch the inspector.

data.title: Add UI Bargraph widget
data.body:
This PR adds a Atomic UI Bargraph widget, it is also be used from script as a UIBargraph. 
It graphs values from 0.0-100.0, which can accessed with SetValueDouble(double), GetValueDouble(), SetValue(int), GetValue()
The axis command can change the drawing orientation to x, y
The bar color can be set with either hex or RGB values.
Setting a skin is needed, the default should be "background_solid"
A "live" demo of a slider changing the bargraph in a layout file is:  
  
             TBSlider: min: 0, max: 100, value: 0, connection: graphit
                   lp: width: 50, height: 16
             TBBarGraph: value: 0, skin: background_solid, color: #00AF34, axis: x, connection: graphit
                    lp: width: 50, height: 16

data.title: Fix preview animations crash #1402
data.body:
This was caused by an assumption that you would only press the Preview Animation button on an animated model, and was blindly using objects to that effect. You can press the button any time you are looking at at model, and it becomes a fair model browser (some models donâ€™t get textures applied). And now you can press any of the animation settings on a static model and it wont crash.
There were some Turbobadger errors coming out, only when I compiled with debug, so I fixed those too.  I left the last line in, but commented out, the token blendcontainer is not used anywhere, maybe for future use?

data.title: [Editor] Crash trying to preview animations if no animations defined
data.body: In the model inspector, if you press the [Preview Animations] button and there are no animations, then the editor crashes to the desktop.

data.title: [Editor Extensions] Iterate on the model and see if it can be simplified or added to
data.body:
Currently the editor extensions model is very powerful, but has a lot of ceremony.  The scaffolding should be iterated on and something simpler put together so that it's extremely easy to set up simple extensions.

See: https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicExamples/blob/master/EditorPlugins/EditorPluginExample/Resources/EditorData/TSExample.plugin.ts

data.title: [Editor Extensions] Create some real world examples
data.body:
Create some more useful examples of using the editor extensions in a project and either post them in the wiki or add to the examples project in the AtomicExamples repo.

Suggestions of real world examples appreciated! :)

Adding support for resource arrays and fixed array sizes to vector inspector

[Editor] Vector Inspector improvements

data.body: Closes #1344

data.title: [Cleanup] Remove Deprecated Items from Milestone 3
data.body:
Rollup task to remove deprecated items that were deprecated in Milestone 3

- [ ] Remove the TS/JS enums as constants from the API documentation.  They will still be available in the API so existing code won't break, but they won't be documented.  A later milestone should probably remove them from the API.
- [ ] Update the Atomic Examples to use the proper enum style instead of the constants

data.title: [C#] Node.GetComponents includes null values in out vector

milestone.title: Issue Staging
milestone.description: A staging area for milestones, while we work through the backlog

data.body:
@JoshEngebretson This issue has not been reproduced in smaller test cases, needs to be addressed by someone with write access to Luma repositories.

In some cases, possibly related to removing components from nodes at runtime, calling Node,GetComponents(Vector<Component>, string, bool) will add a null reference into the output vector, as well as all the actual components.

data.title: Fixes #1305 - Convert constants to enums
data.body:
This PR adds new JS object literals to the Atomic namespace that allows for more proper enums instead of having to use constants.  Now, in both TS and JS, instead of using:
```
Atomic.BT_STATIC
```

you can use
```
Atomic.BodyType2D.BT_STATIC
```


The original constants are still present in the Atomic namespace so existing code doesn't break, but it is flagged to be removed.  I also left the existing constants in the ```d.ts```, but am contemplating removing it.  The repercussions would be that existing TS that uses the constants would have transpilation errors and would have to be converted to use the enums, but the JS would work fine.  Also, it would clean up the auto-generated documentations and not have all those extra constants.  Thoughts?

Each of the existing legacy constants has a comment stating that it is deprecated and points to the corresponding enum.

data.title: Adding Frustum to bindings
data.body:
C# primarily as JS/TS need stack marshaling helpers also wraps managed application running in a try/catch block (for handling inner exceptions)

There's also a test in the AtomicTests repo: https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicTests/blob/master/CSharpTests/FrustumTest

![frustum](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/376203/22046552/46d2c972-dcd6-11e6-8795-b97a93557182.gif)

data.title: Incorrect tab selection when resource editor is closed and then a newâ€¦
data.body:
â€¦ one is opened

Steps to reproduce:

1. open a resource in Atomic Editor
2. open another one (after this step we have two tabs)
3. close the first tab without selecting it (just press the X)
4. open another resource

Result: Both tabs are selected and we can see the contents of the tab
created in step 2 instead of the one created in step 4

This happens only when we close tabs that reside on the left hand side
of the currently selected tab.

Reason: TBTabContainer::m_current_page is not updated when tabs are
closed

data.title: Toggle button contrast #1267 and psd files #1292
data.body:
This pr makes a new skin element specifically for buttons in toggle mode. It adds a pressed image that is higher contrast than the button pressed image. Attempting to change the button pressed to be higher contrast was visible and distracting. This way the down state image can be adjusted separately.
I also removed the psd files in the turbobadger skin directories, as per reasoning in #1292
